result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamonte A Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $89.99 to Karen N.  Restitution to Arthella M. to be determined at restitution hearing.

Pay Court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have part time job.  Obtain GED or HSED.
Mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages presribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Rights of Passage Group Home located at 7911 W. Beechwood, Milwaukee, Karen N. and Arthelia M.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Anger management assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamonte A Patterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamonte A Patterson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Lamonte A Patterson in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNT 2.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed.   Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty in COUNT 2 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 248 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $89.99 to Karen N. and restitution to Arthella M. to be determined at a restitution hearing 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Rights of Passage Group Home located at 7911 W. Beechwood, Milwaukee; Karen N. and Arthella M. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*  Original Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant has another matter pending before the Court (14CF004174).  Parties engaged in negotiations for potential global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case should have been assigned to Judge Brash.

Defendant Lamonte A Patterson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Lamonte A Patterson in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KAREN N. OR HER RESIDENCE OR ANY PLACE WHERE SHE IS KNOWN TO BE; ARTHELLA M. OR HER RESIDENCE OR ANY KNOWN PLACE WHERE SHE IS KNOWN TO BE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamonte A Patterson in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Lamonte A Patterson in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
